courseDescription: The fundamentals of real estate productivity and value are developed. Legal elements of real estate transactions, physical aspects of real estate location and production, and economic factors pertinent to real estate.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of real estate transaction laws
Familiarity with physical aspects of real estate
Awareness of economic factors impacting real estate
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Negotiation skills for real estate transactions
Ability to effectively communicate real estate concepts
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze real estate productivity and value
Ability to evaluate economic factors in real estate
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ability to manage real estate transactions
Understanding of real estate planning and development

courseDescription: A faculty supervised, professionally oriented project. Approval for enrollment and allowable credits is determined by the department chair. A transfer student must have completed one semester at Old Dominion University.
This course explores the different financing and ownership arrangements used in real estate transactions.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating the financial viability of real estate investments
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading negotiations on financing and ownership arrangements

courseDescription: Economic theories of value applied to real estate as a guide to business decisions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding and applying economic theories of value
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of real estate values
Analyzing economic trends and their impact on real estate

courseDescription: Examination of developments in real estate valuation and investment with use of computer terminal models.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of real estate investment developments
